alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 02 at 4:02PM CDT until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... NB Chicago River at Chicago (Grand Ave) affecting Cook County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...NB Chicago River from Confluence with the North Shore Channel downstream to Summit, including the Chicago (Grand Ave) gauge. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 2.0 feet, Low-lying sections of the Chicago Riverwalk are threatened. Low-lying sections of Ping Tom Park are inundated. At 3.0 feet, Numerous stretches of the Chicago Riverwalk are inundated. USACE and MWRD consider opening of Chicago Lock to reduce flood impacts. At 3.5 feet, Commercial areas of the Chicago Riverwalk are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 2.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest near 3.0 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 3.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by Monday morning.
